did.unittitle: Papers relating to America in the Dalhousie Muniments, 1748-1759
did.abstract: These concern James Glen, Governor of South Carolina from 1743 to 1756, and John Forbes, Colonel and later Brigadier General in the British Forces stationed in North America. There are references to South Carolina politics and government, Indian policy, and the French and Indian War.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Micro Methods, Ltd. and accessioned, 06/28/1966 (1966 1244mf).

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The presence of these papers in the Dalhousie Muniments is explained by the connections between James Glen and John Forbes and the Dalhousie family. Glen was Forbe's executor, and his niece married the 8th Earl of Dalhousie.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Originals in Dalhousie Muniments, Scottish Record Office, General Register House, Edinburgh.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This is a microfilm of an early American collection that may be of interest to researchers at the APS and may complement an original manuscript collection at the APS.
